Articles.Content:
1 hour ago, qzgy said:

Are we talking "blizzard" as in a light dusting of snow or proper blizzard?

Heh heh heh
Very windy in The Netherlands and some parts of Northern Germany. People flying around, trees tripping over, that kind of stuff. Not full on Irma, luckily.

Thursday before last Thursday: Well below freezing with winds up to 40 mph and wind chills below 0 F. Oh and it’s a freaking blizzard outside with a foot of snow on the ground. 

Last Thursday: It’s almost 60 F and pouring rain and all the snow is gone and it feels like spring. 

This Thursday: Temperatures hovering between 20 and 35 F all day, with wind chills between 10-20 F and several inches of snow on the ground. 

What the hell is wrong with New England.

Down in southern Minnesota it looks like were gonna get blasted with over a foot of snow and 45 MPH winds. It seems like we always get screwed over, the storm tracks south, we get barely any snow, or it rains. I cant remember when we had a real blizzard. last year they had blizzard warning, closed the schools and university (which they never do). Turns out we get 1 inch of snow, most of melts.

It’s only January in Spain and we r already getting temperatures over 20° C. Aaaand we’re in the middle of a drought.

 

What a wonderful winter! (Sarcastically)

Ya'll should get this thing:

I just ordered one for a mere 75 bucks (plus 150 for the sign and 200 for the rope and arm-hook thing) and I can already tell it'll be totally worth it!
cough cough, sarcasm....
Edited January 22, 2018 by Earthlinger
School got let out a whole 20 minutes early over this. There's about six inches of snow on the ground, and my street hasn't been plowed yet.
We finally got our first real snow of the year here on Saturday. Almost an inch at my house, and three inches at work. Actually stuck around for more than a morning.
Just finished snowblowing about a foot of snow off my driveway.

On 1/18/2018 at 8:40 PM, ProtoJeb21 said:

Thursday before last Thursday: Well below freezing with winds up to 40 mph and wind chills below 0 F. Oh and it’s a freaking blizzard outside with a foot of snow on the ground. 

Last Thursday: It’s almost 60 F and pouring rain and all the snow is gone and it feels like spring. 

This Thursday: Temperatures hovering between 20 and 35 F all day, with wind chills between 10-20 F and several inches of snow on the ground. 

What the hell is wrong with New England. 

Tell me about it (upstate NY has gotten a similar treatment). It just gets better, too:

Next Thursday: Forecast to be 25 F, following a freeze on Wednesday which itself is following rain on Tuesday. We all know what that means...
The seasons keep changing. It snowed Wednesday and then was 60F over the weekend. Now it's 57 and raining.

*Pokes hand outside and looks up at a clear sky with a 36º current temperature*

I hate you guys.........................................................

*Hand retreats out as the skin becomes dry and rough*

So. So much.

Stop scooping up the cold, humid weather!

We only had a centimeter of snow in twenty years, and this winter we almost had no rain! We’re currently at 16° Celsius, when we should be at 12°! 

 

Stupid global warming, messing the weather up.

Relatively stable weather for this week. 

Which is very rare for living in the middle of the US. Last week it was 4 degrees, heat wave came in and made it run up to the low 70s.

 

30s-50s all week

On 1/23/2018 at 10:15 AM, DarkOwl57 said:

*Pokes hand outside and looks up at a clear sky with a 36º current temperature*

I hate you guys.........................................................

*Hand retreats out as the skin becomes dry and rough*

So. So much.

That sounds kinda nice.

Here it was dreary and miserable yesterday, raining heavily and sporadically with sudden bursts of sunlight before chilling somewhat today.

10 hours ago, qzgy said:

That sounds kinda nice.

Here it was dreary and miserable yesterday, raining heavily and sporadically with sudden bursts of sunlight before chilling somewhat today.

It's the opposite of what I want. If it's cold, I WANT IT SNOWING GOSHDARNIT!

A rare occurrence here happened this morning:

https://elapuron.com/noticias/sociedad/110603/una-tromba-marina-la-costa-san-andres-sauces/

13 minutes ago, Green Baron said:

A rare occurrence here happened this morning:

https://elapuron.com/noticias/sociedad/110603/una-tromba-marina-la-costa-san-andres-sauces/

 

Oh neat!!!  We get those around here now and then... Beautiful, and harmless enough, if they stay over the water.

Here it's rainy and crappy... but it's a good thing. We need as much rain as possible to accumulate now so we don't have a bad fire season later this spring.
Massive storm just flew over and took out the power grid. Fun waiting in pitch black with a shaky connection to the mobile networks.
For the past day or so, just dreary miserable on and off-ish rain. Also somewhere around 5 to 10 degrees maybe? Just miserable.
Still no power, humidity 97% or something and temp 37°C, and its 9:18PM. Lovely.
The weather is weird on jakarta. Sometime we had Heavy rain for 10 min and then Stop raining. And then a couple min later Light rain comes in and it stop again

There’s a rapidly intensifying Category 4 equivalent tropical cyclone named Gita about to hit a tiny island nation in the South Pacific basin. Winds are currently at 145 mph with a central pressure of 930 mbar. It’s now the strongest tropical cyclone of 2018 so far, surpassing the 130 mph winds of Cyclone Cebile and the 940 mbar pressur of Cyclone Berguitta, both in the South West Indian Ocean basin. 

Edited February 12, 2018 by ProtoJeb21

http://mobile.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-13/tonga-cyclone-gita-category-four-causes-widespread-damage/9425298

Seems like Tonga has been hit hard. Fiji is next apparently too.

In other news, the power is largely back on minus the internet. And its raining now which is great.
I guess winter's not quite done with us yet. It rained two nights this week.
